detaileddescription.para: The Thread needed for implementing coroutine behaviour.
The scheduling priority of the process.
Determines whether or not the life cycle of this process will start again after finishing. Default is false, i.e. the lifecycle will only by executed once.

If this SimProcess is cooperating as a slave with a master process, it keeps a reference to its master here. Master is set in the cooperate() -method, when the slave cooperates with his master and deleted every time the slave process is activated.
If this SimProcess is cooperating as a slave it has to wait in this waitQueue until a master is cooperating with it.
The InterruptCode with which this SimProcess is interrupted.
The InterruptException with which this SimProcess is interrupted.
The Vector holding all the resources this SimProcess is using at the moment.
A reference to the container this SimProcess belongs to. Is null as long as this SimProcess is not contained in any ComplexSimProcess.

The realTime deadline for this SimProcess in nanoseconds. In case of a real-time execution (i. e. the execution speed rate is set to a positive value) the Scheduler will produce a warning message if a deadline is missed.
The Event which will interrupt the current SimProcess at a given point in simulation time if it is not removed from the event list before that time instant.
The last Schedulable that has activated this process.
Displays the current blocked status of this SimProcess. A SimProcess is blocked whenever it has to wait inside a queue or synchronization object.
Displays the current status of this SimProcess. Is true if lifeCycle method has finished, false if it is still running or has not been started yet

Displays if the thread in of control of this SimProcess is already the associated simthread. Is true if the simthread is active and is carrying on its lifeCycle. Is false if it has not started its lifeCycle yet or is terminated already.

memberdef.argsstring: (Model owner, String name, boolean repeating, boolean showInTrace)
memberdef.name: SimProcess

detaileddescription.para: The most general constructor of a SimProcess.

parameterdescription.para: String : The name of the SimProcess
Model : The model this SimProcess is associated to

boolean : Flag to set the SimProcess' repeating behaviour: If set to true, the lifeCycle will be executed again after completion, while false will create a process whose lifeCycle is executed only once.
boolean : Flag for showing SimProcess in trace-files. Set it to true if SimProcess should show up in trace. Set it to false if SimProcess should not be shown in trace.

detaileddescription.para: Short-cut constructor of a SimProcess whose lifeCycle() is only executed once.

parameterdescription.para: String : The name of the SimProcess
Model : The model this SimProcess is associated to
boolean : Flag for showing SimProcess in trace-files. Set it to true if SimProcess should show up in trace. Set it to false if SimProcess should not be shown in trace.

detaileddescription.para: Schedules the SimProcess to be activated at the present point in simulation time, yielding the same result as calling activate(new TimeSpan(0)). The process will continue executing its lifeCycle method.

xrefdescription.para: Replaced by activate(TimeSpan dt). Schedules the SimProcess to be activated at the given time offset to the current simulation time. This will allow a SimProcess to continue executing its lifeCycle method.

parameterdescription.para: SimTime : The offset to the current simulation time that this SimProcess is due to be activated

detaileddescription.para: Schedules the SimProcess to be activated at the given point in simulation time. This will allow a SimProcess to continue executing its lifeCycle method.

parameterdescription.para: TimeInstant : The point in simulation time this process is to be activated.

detaileddescription.para: Schedules the SimProcess to be activated at the specified point in simulation time. The point of time is given as an offset to the current simulation time. This will allow a SimProcess to continue executing its lifeCycle method. Thus in contrast to the entity, no Event is needed for scheduling here.

parameterdescription.para: TimeSpan : The offset to the current simulation time this process is to be activated

detaileddescription.para: Schedules this SimProcess to be activated directly after the given Schedulable, which itself is already scheduled. Note that this SimProcess' point of simulation time will be set to be the same as the Schedulable's time. Thus this SimProcess will continue to execute its lifeCycle method directly after the given Schedulable but the simulation clock will not change. Please make sure that the Schedulable given as parameter is actually scheduled.

parameterdescription.para: Schedulable : The Schedulable this SimProcess should be scheduled after

detaileddescription.para: Schedules this SimProcess to be activated directly before the given Schedulable, which itself is already scheduled. Note that this SimProcess' point of simulation time will be set to be the same as the Schedulable's time. Thus this SimProcess will continue to execute its lifeCycle method directly before the given Schedulable but the simulation clock will not change. Please make sure that the Schedulable given as parameter is actually scheduled.

parameterdescription.para: Schedulable : The Schedulable this SimProcess should be scheduled before

detaileddescription.para: Clears the currently scheduled delayed interrupt so that it wont be performed. This Method should be called to cancel a previously scheduled delayed interrupt. This is typically the case if all steps to be covered by the delayed interrupt have been performed in time (before the delayed interrupt could be executed).
Returns true if this process can cooperate with another SimProcess. If this process is already cooperating with a master false is returned.

simplesect.para: boolean : Is this process ready to cooperate with another SimProcess?

detaileddescription.para: Resets the interrupt-status of this SimProcess to not interrupted. Should be called every time the SimProcess has successfully dealt with the interrupt. The internal InterruptCode of this SimProcess will be reset to null.

The current (master) process is calling this method (within WaitQueue.cooperate()) on the slave process to lead him through the joint cooperation. After the joint cooperation is finished the master is still active and after him the slave will be activated.
Returns the InterruptCode from this SimProcess. If this SimProcess is not interrupted, the InterruptCode is null.

simplesect.para: irqCode : The InterruptCode of this SimProcess.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the master when two SimProcesses are cooperating. If this method is called on a SimProcess which is not a slave null is returned.

simplesect.para: SimProcess : The master process during the cooperation or null if this process is not a slave process.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the realTime deadline for this SimProcess (in nanoseconds). In case of a real-time execution (i. e. the execution speed rate is set to a positive value) the Scheduler will produce a warning message if a deadline is missed.
Returns the waiting-queue in which this SimProcess is waiting as a slave to cooperate with a master. If this method is called on a SimProcess which is not a slave null is returned.

simplesect.para: ProcessQueue : The waiting-queue in which this SimProcess is waiting as a slave or null if this SimProcess is not waiting as a slave for cooperation.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the supervising ComplexSimProcess this SimProcess is contained in.

simplesect.para: ComplexSimProcess : The supervising ComplexSimProcess this SimProcess is contained in. Is null if this SimProcess is not contained in any ComplexSimProcess.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the last Schedulable that did cause the last activation (or interruption) of this SimProcess.

simplesect.para: Schedulable : The Schedulable (e.g. other SimProcess, Event...) that has caused the last activation of this SimProcess. As processes may activate themselves, e.g. though a hold(TimeSpan t) or an activate(TimeSpan t), this method may return a reference to this process. The method returns null if this process has not yet been activated.

xrefdescription.para: Replaced by hold(TimeSpan dt). Passivates a SimProcess for the time given. The simthread of this SimProcess is put into a lock and the scheduler, resp. the experiment's main thread is released from its block and continues with the next EventNote to be processed.

parameterdescription.para: desmoj.SimTime : The duration of the SimProcess' passivation

detaileddescription.para: Passivates a SimProcess until the given point in simulation time. The simthread of this SimProcess is put into a lock and the scheduler, resp. the experiment's main thread is released from its block and continues with the next event-note to be processed.

parameterdescription.para: TimeInstant : The point in simulation time when the SimProcess' passivation ends.

detaileddescription.para: Passivates a SimProcess for the given span of time. The simthread of this SimProcess is put into a lock and the scheduler, resp. the experiment's main thread is released from its block and continues with the next EventNote to be processed.

parameterdescription.para: TimeSpan : The duration of the SimProcess' passivation

detaileddescription.para: Passivates a SimProcess for span of time sampled from the distribution provided to the method. The sample is interpreted in the reference time unit. The SimThread of this SimProcess is put into a lock and the scheduler, resp. the experiment's main thread is released from its block and continues with the next EventNote to be processed.

parameterdescription.para: NumericalDist<?> : Numerical distribution to sample the duration of the SimProcess' passivation from

detaileddescription.para: Interrupts the SimProcess setting the given InterruptCode as the reason for the interruption. Blocked, terminated or already interrupted SimProcesses can not be interrupted. In this case a warning message will be produced and the interrupt will be ignord. If the SimProcess is cooperating as a slave the interrupt will be passed to the master.

parameterdescription.para: desmoj.InterruptCode

detaileddescription.para: Interrupts the SimProcess by throwing the given InterruptException in it's lifeCylce() method. The InterruptException contains an InterruptCode as the reason for the interruption. Blocked, terminated or already interrupted SimProcesses can not be interrupted. In this case a warning message will be produced and the interrupt will be ignord. If the SimProcess is cooperating as a slave the interrupt will be passed to the master.

parameterdescription.para: desmoj.InterruptException

detaileddescription.para: Schedules this process to be interrupted at the given point in simulation time. Only one delayed interrupt can be scheduled at a time. If a delayed interrupt is scheduled after another delayed interrupt has already been scheduled a warning message will be produced and the new delayed interrupt will not be scheduled.
A delayed Interrupt must be cleared manually by calling clearInterruptDelayed() on the SimProcess if it wasn't performed.

parameterdescription.para: The Point in time when the interrupt is to be performed.

simplesect.para: The event which will (at the given point in time) triger the interrupt of this process

detaileddescription.para: Schedules this process to be interrupted after the given delay. Only one delayed interrupt can be scheduled at a time. If a delayed interrupt is scheduled after another delayed interrupt has already been scheduled a warning message will be produced and the delayed interrupt will not be scheduled.
A delayed Interrupt must be cleared manually by calling clearInterruptDelayed() on the SimProcess if it wasn't performed.

parameterdescription.para: The delay after which the interrupt is to be performed.

simplesect.para: The event which will (after the given delay) triger the interrupt of this process

detaileddescription.para: Returns the current block-status of the SimProcess. If a SimProcess is blocked, it is waiting inside a queue or synchronization block for it's release.

simplesect.para: boolean : Is true if SimProcess is blocked, false otherwise

detaileddescription.para: Returns the current repeating-status of the SimProcess. If a SimProcess is repeating, the lifeCycle will be executed again after finishing.

simplesect.para: boolean : Is true if the lifeCycle of the process will be repeated finishing, while false indicates the process will terminate after the lifeCycle is completed.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the current component status of this SimProcess. If a SimProcess is a component of a ComplexSimProcess it is blocked and passivated. It exists only within the ComplexSimProcess; it's own lifeCycle is stopped and will only be activated again when it is removed from the ComplexSimProcess.

simplesect.para: boolean :true if and only if this SimProcess is a component (part of) a ComplexSimProcess; false otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the current interrupt-status of this SimProcess. If a SimProcess is interrupted, it should deal with the interrupt and then call the clearInterruptCode() -method.

simplesect.para: boolean : Is true if this SimProcess is interrupted, false otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the current status of the SimProcess. If a SimProcess is terminated, it has already finished its lifeCycle() method and can not further be used as a SimProcess. A terminated SimProcess can still be used like any other Entity which it is derived from.

simplesect.para: boolean : Is true if the SimProcess is terminated, false otherwise

detaileddescription.para: Override this method in a subclass of SimProcess to implement the specific behaviour of this SimProcess. This method starts after a SimProcess has been created and activated. Note that this method will be executed once or repeatedly, depending on the repeating status of the SimProcess.
Makes the SimProcess obtain an array of resources and store them for further usage.

parameterdescription.para: Resource[] : The array of resources obtained.

detaileddescription.para: Passivates the SimProcess for an indefinite time. This method must be called by the SimProcess' own Thread only. The SimProcess can only be reactivated by another SimProcess or Entity.

The current (master) process is calling this method (within TransportJunction.cooperate()) on the slave process to make him prepare for the transportation. After the transport is finished the master is still active and after him the slave will be activated.

Re-schedules the SimProcess to be activated at the given TimeSpan offset to the current simulation time. The SimProcess has already been scheduled but is now supposed to be reactivated at some other point of simulation time.

parameterdescription.para: TimeSpan : The offset to the current simulation time that this SimProcess is due to be re-activated

detaileddescription.para: Gets the InterruptCode from the master and resets the master to null.
Makes the SimProcess return all resources it holds at the moment to all the different Res pools it is holding resources from. This is useful in situations the Simprocess is about to terminate.
Makes the SimProcess return a certain number of resources of the given resource pool.

parameterdescription.para: Res : The resource pool which resources will be returned.
int : The number of resources which will be returned.

simplesect.para: Resource[] : the array containing the resources which will be returned.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the SimProcess' blocked status to the boolean value given. This is necessary for some operations in conjunction with some synchronization classes.

parameterdescription.para: boolean : The new value for the blocked status

detaileddescription.para: Sets the SimProcess' repeating status to the boolean value given, permitting the process' lifeCycle to either start again (true) or terminate (false) after the current cycle is completed. Note that setting setting this property to true after the the process has terinated has no effect.

parameterdescription.para: boolean : The new value for the repeating status

detaileddescription.para: Returns the current repeating-status of the SimProcess. If a SimProcess is repeating, the lifeCycle will be executed again after finishing.

simplesect.para: boolean : Is true if the lifeCycle of the process will be repeated finishing, while false indicates the process will terminate after the lifeCycle is completed. Sets the realTime deadline for this SimProcess (in nanoseconds). In case of a real-time execution (i. e. the execution speed rate is set to a positive value) the Scheduler will produce a warning message if a deadline is missed.

parameterdescription.para: the realTimeConstraint in nanoseconds to set

detaileddescription.para: Sets the SimProcess' slaveWaitQueue variable to the ProcessQueue in which this SimProcess is waiting as a slave to cooperate with a master.

parameterdescription.para: ProcessQueue : The waiting-queue in which this SimProcess is waiting as a slave to cooperate with a master.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the process' scheduling priority. The scheduling priority is used to determine which process to execute first if two or more processes are activated at the same instant. The default priority is zero. Higher priorities are positive, lower priorities negative.

Sets the process' scheduling priority to a given integer value. The default priority (unless assigned otherwise) is zero. Negative priorities are lower, positive priorities are higher. All values should be inside the range defined by Java's integral integer data type [-2147483648, +2147483647].

An process' scheduling priority it used to determine which process is executed first if activated at the same time instant. Should the priority be the same, order of event execution depends on the EventList in use, e.g. activated first is executed first (EventTreeList) or random (RandomizingEventTreeList).

parameterdescription.para: int : The new scheduling priority value

detaileddescription.para: As there is no generally applicable means of cloning a SimProcess (which would require cloning the execution state as well), this method returns a CloneNotSupportedException.

simplesect.para: SimProcess : A copy of this process.

detaileddescription.para: Returns a clone of the internal Vector containing all the Resource objects this SimProcess is using at the moment.

simplesect.para: java.util.Vector : the internal Vector containing all the Resource objects this SimProcess is using at the moment.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the supervising ComplexSimProcess this SimProcess is contained in. Setting it to null indicates that this SimProcess is not contained in any ComplexSimProcess (anymore).

parameterdescription.para: desmoj.ComplexSimProcess : The ComplexSimProcess which serves as a container for this SimProcess.

detaileddescription.para: Method to release the waiting scheduler when the SimThread finishes.
Sets the last Schedulable which has (re)activated or interrupted this SimProcess.

parameterdescription.para: Schedulable : The Schedulable that has (re)activated or interrupted this SimProcess or null to un-set this information.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the current running status of the SimProcess. If a SimProcess is not ready, it has already finished its lifeCycle() method and can not further be used as a SimProcess. A terminated SimProcess can still be used like any other Entity which it is derived from.

simplesect.para: boolean : Is true if the SimProcess is terminated, false otherwise

detaileddescription.para: Used to synchronize the change of control between scheduler and SimProcesses. This method must only be called by the scheduler resp. the experiment's main thread in order to prevent multiple SimProcess' threads running in parallel which has to be avoided.
Sets the SimProcess' running status to the boolean value given. This is necessary for some operations in conjunction with synchronization classes.

parameterdescription.para: boolean : The new value for the running status

detaileddescription.para: Sets the attribute indicating that this SimProcess' simthread has finished to the given value. This method is used by class SimThread only.

parameterdescription.para: boolean : The new value for the attribute indicating the SimThread's end

detaileddescription.para: Starts the simthread associated with this SimProcess. This is method must be called the first time a SimProcess is supposed to start processing its lifeCycle() method.

SimProcess represents entities with an own active lifecycle. Since SimProcesses are in fact special entities with extended capabilities (esp. the method lifeCycle()), they inherit from Entity and thus can also be used in conjunction with events. So they can be handled in both ways, event- and process-oriented. Clients are supposed to implement the lifeCycle() method to specify the individual behaviour of a special SimProcess subclass. Since implementing activity- and transaction-oriented synchronization mechanisms requires significant changes in this class, methods that have been implemented by Soenke Claassen have been marked.
